metadata.synopsis: Jergal, a god of the dead, awaits the player in camp. He is bound by the judgment of another god - Helm - to assist the players as penance for past crimes. He provides resurrection services to the players.

32.speaker: Withers
32.text: Fate spins along as it should. Have you need of my services?

52.speaker: Withers
52.text: Thou hast now a bosom-companion. Take care that thou art not distracted on thy quest, seeking the comforts of the flesh.

203.speaker: Player
203.text: I kiss Wyll once and I get a lecture from a pile of bones!

247.speaker: Player
247.text: It was that obvious about me and Astarion, huh?

89.speaker: Player
89.text: It was just a moment in the Weave, 'bosoms' haven't been involved yet!

374.speaker: Withers
374.text: Recall that in time, all becomes dust and bone.

456.speaker: Player
456.text: Lae'zel would never allow herself to be distracted from her mission.

406.speaker: Player
406.text: With Minthara I'm lucky to have woken up alive.

248.speaker: Player
248.text: Don't be grumpy. I really want to make Karlach happy.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: You mean Shadowheart...? Gods, I wish she were my 'bosom-companion'.

174.speaker: Player
174.text: It isn't about the 'flesh' - it's about companionship.

361.speaker: Player
361.text: I will enjoy myself whenever I please.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: I'm more than capable of doing both.

442.speaker: Player
442.text: My love life is none of your business, skeleton.

64.speaker: Withers
64.text: Walk in grace, soul of light.

216.speaker: Withers
216.text: Dost thou require a new ally? Or mayhaps a resurrection, instead?

7.speaker: Player
7.text: I didn't mean to kill Alfira. Please bring her back.

213.speaker: Withers
213.text: The bard's death is a weight for thine own conscience to bear.

80.speaker: Withers
80.text: She will be left to the peace of eternity, where the Urge shall seek her no more.

241.speaker: Player
241.text: I didn't mean to kill Quil. Please bring her back.

476.speaker: Player
476.text: Please bring back Astarion. I can't live with what I did.

187.speaker: Player
187.text: Please bring back Shadowheart. I can't live with what I did.

256.speaker: Player
256.text: Please bring back Gale. I can't live with what I did.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Please bring back Karlach. I can't live with what I did.

377.speaker: Withers
377.text: Thou didst not kill thine own friend. Thou offered thy friend as sacrifice.

190.speaker: Withers
190.text: Their soul is in a place even I cannot peer into. A place no soul should venture.

85.speaker: Withers
85.text: Death alone was not suffering enough for thine Urge. Thou shouldst fear thyself.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: Please bring back Wyll. I can't live with what I did.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: Please bring back Lae'zel. I can't live with what I did.

120.speaker: Player
120.text: I found in a plaque in a Chapel about a 'Guardian of Tombs'. Is that you?

236.speaker: Player
236.text: I dismissed one of my adventuring companions - where are they?

296.speaker: Withers
296.text: Safely resting in the wardrobe in thy camp. Preserved just so 'til their soul's return - or thou hast need of them.

239.speaker: Player
239.text: Absent adventurers disappear into a wardrobe of yours - why?

75.speaker: Withers
75.text: Without the balance of a soul, a force to drive them, vessels like thine sit limp like garments unworn.

295.speaker: Withers
295.text: Wouldst be a shame to leave thy comrade's vessels crumpled, wouldst it not?

475.speaker: Player
475.text: How can I remove fellow adventurers from my party?

182.speaker: Withers
182.text: Remember - thou canst only remove adventurers fully authored by mortal hands. Seekest thy fellow, and ask them to wait in thy camp.

168.speaker: Withers
168.text: Only then canst their empty forms be preserved - neatly stored in mine wardrobe til thou hast need of them.

420.speaker: Withers
420.text: Then thou must return with the proper payment.

76.speaker: Withers
76.text: This is the price of balance. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

306.speaker: Withers
306.text: Well-counted. I recommend keeping thy distance for a moment.

378.speaker: Player
378.text: Changed my mind. They can stay dead for now.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Actually, there's something else I need from you.

289.speaker: Player
289.text: I want to resurrect all of my fallen companions. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

472.speaker: Withers
472.text: This is the price of balance. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

403.speaker: Player
403.text: One of my companions has fallen, may I entrust them to your watch for now?

402.speaker: Player
402.text: I don't have enough coin to bring someone back just now, can I entrust them to your watch?

286.speaker: Player
286.text: I want you to watch over [CAMP_Jergal_PlayerToResurrect_1_c85cdca4-6579-776d-206d-6967e4999281].

428.speaker: Player
428.text: I want you to watch over [CAMP_Jergal_PlayerToResurrect_2_b1161c91-1bde-6a1c-297e-ee0bfc1a57c4].

178.speaker: Player
178.text: I want you to watch over [CAMP_Jergal_PlayerToResurrect_3_56966d5e-534d-4930-264e-050a2345db3d].

362.speaker: Player
362.text: I would like to collect one of my fallen companions.

91.speaker: Withers
91.text: The fallen will rise when they are summoned. But thou must first make space for them amongst the living.

381.speaker: Withers
381.text: Which of them dost thou require?

160.speaker: Player
160.text: I'd like you to return Shadowheart.

292.speaker: Player
292.text: I'd like you to return Karlach.

185.speaker: Player
185.text: I'd like you to return Wyll.

404.speaker: Player
404.text: I'd like you to return Gale.

276.speaker: Player
276.text: I'd like you to return Astarion.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: I'd like you to return Lae'zel.

197.speaker: Player
197.text: I'd like you to return Halsin.

278.speaker: Player
278.text: I'd like you to return Jaheira.

445.speaker: Player
445.text: I'd like you to return Minthara.

152.speaker: Player
152.text: I'd like you to return Minsc.

250.speaker: Withers
250.text: Thou wilt now find them as they were. Exactly as thou last remembered them.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Changed my mind. They can stay dead for now.

298.speaker: Withers
298.text: I shall watch over them still until thou changest thy mind.

421.speaker: Player
421.text: I would like to talk about hirelings.

424.speaker: Player
424.text: Can you help me change my class? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_4_5dac5eea-faeb-459c-b675-46c51519b784])

60.speaker: Withers
60.text: Thou hast broken thy oath. Before I can aid thee, thou must atone.

398.speaker: Withers
398.text: Most impossible, for thou art illithid.

297.speaker: Withers
297.text: Although thou dost not seem to be in need of my services.

193.speaker: Player
193.text: I found a plaque in a crypt about a 'Guardian of Tombs'. Is that where you came from?

457.speaker: Player
457.text: What other services do you provide?

201.speaker: Withers
201.text: I shall be here in thy camp, for whenever thou hast need of my services.

206.speaker: Player
206.text: Not to be rude, but what are you?

396.speaker: Withers
396.text: There are many answers to that question. None are important.

338.speaker: Player
338.text: Skeletons aren't supposed to be able to talk.

394.speaker: Player
394.text: Are you going to explain further?

90.speaker: Player
90.text: If you won't answer, then get out of my camp.

380.speaker: Player
380.text: Focus on the divine energy you feel from his presence.

323.speaker: Narrator
323.text: *He has a divine aspect, yes, a reflection of death itself. Eternal and inescapable.*

39.speaker: Player
39.text: All that power - are you a god's Chosen?

356.speaker: Withers
356.text: I shall answer no further questions in that regard.

231.speaker: Player
231.text: Are you a herald of my deity?

144.speaker: Withers
144.text: I am not. Myrkul and I walk very different paths.

473.speaker: Player
473.text: Are you a Chosen of Kelemvor?

136.speaker: Withers
136.text: No, although Kelemvor chose well to bless one such as yourself.

14.speaker: Narrator
14.text: *There is great divine energy indeed, but the source is unclear.*

137.speaker: Player
137.text: I found a plaque in a crypt about a 'Guardian of Tombs'. Is that where you came from?

200.speaker: Withers
200.text: That is where I was... housed, yes. And thou needst not know why.

299.speaker: Player
299.text: You were sorting something before. What were you doing?

255.speaker: Player
255.text: Will these hirelings be joining me willingly?

334.speaker: Player
334.text: Do you think I can trust these cultists?

128.speaker: Player
128.text: Impressive. Are there other ways you can help us?

29.speaker: Player
29.text: What kind of services can a skeleton offer?

138.speaker: Withers
138.text: A mending of the threads between life and death.

34.speaker: Withers
34.text: Should thou or any of thy compatriots perish, I will cleave soul to body once more.

315.speaker: Player
315.text: That's incredibly powerful magic. Why is it so easy for you?

184.speaker: Withers
184.text: Because it is my calling. There is little else to explain.

357.speaker: Player
357.text: You mentioned a cost - what is it?

269.speaker: Withers
269.text: Such is life: outrage leading to a singular end.

205.speaker: Player
205.text: What if I don't have that kind of gold right now? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

191.speaker: Withers
191.text: Then I shall wait here patiently until it is acquired.

251.speaker: Player
251.text: At least that's straightforward. I want to resurrect someone.

386.speaker: Withers
386.text: Very well. Speak their name and it shall be done.

414.speaker: Player
414.text: I could use those resurrection services right now.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: And look very ugly doing it.

400.speaker: Player
400.text: Helpful. No one's dead on my side at the moment, though.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Care to explain why you're helping me?

100.speaker: Withers
100.text: Be assured it is not by choice.

179.speaker: Withers
179.text: The girl has left to hew her own path.

153.speaker: Withers
153.text: She left you a letter. Thou couldst read it. Or thou couldst not. Such is the way of autonomy.

224.speaker: Withers
224.text: She left behind a letter, as thou doth know.

261.speaker: Withers
261.text: The girl could not bear thou, a breaker of promises. I told her the fate of her parents when the wind carried it to me.

43.speaker: Withers
43.text: She has left this place to hew a new path.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: I would like to talk about hirelings.

23.speaker: Withers
23.text: Very well. Let us see how long thy understanding takes.

103.speaker: Withers
103.text: You are indebted to Elminster Aumar. I shall accept coin on his behalf.
103.context: NodeContext: el-MINN-ster OW-mahr (as in OW, I hurt my foot.)

67.speaker: Withers
67.text: Dost thou require a new ally? Or mayhaps a resurrection, instead?

272.speaker: Withers
272.text: If that be so, I wish thee good travels.

105.speaker: Withers
105.text: Ah, another. Thy name has been recorded.

192.speaker: Withers
192.text: Fate spins along as it should.

284.speaker: Withers
284.text: Thou walkest alone. On all these harsh nights, thou hast sought no company.

122.speaker: Withers
122.text: Love is no domain of mine. But it is often cited as the purpose of mortal life. Wherefore turnst thou from it?

434.speaker: Player
434.text: I feel so much hate. Pure hate, for everything around me.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: I don't wish to burden another with my madness.

460.speaker: Player
460.text: This 'love' is against my queen's creed.

351.speaker: Player
351.text: It's against the instincts of my people. Turncoat or not, I am still Gith.

416.speaker: Player
416.text: I can't think about myself - I've got a war to stop.

188.speaker: Player
188.text: Please - as if anyone here deserves me.

451.speaker: Player
451.text: The closer you get to someone, the easier it is for them to stab you in the back.

320.speaker: Player
320.text: I would've liked to. Loved to. But it just didn't happen for me.

240.speaker: Player
240.text: I am still ever-haunted by Mystra.

415.speaker: Player
415.text: If I found a companion, I would only have to shed them eventually.

233.speaker: Player
233.text: My fellow travellers don't seem to like me enough...

72.speaker: Player
72.text: I have better things to be doing.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: I really don't want to talk to you about this.

331.speaker: Player
331.text: My love life is none of your business, skeleton.

352.speaker: Withers
352.text: ...Not this one. Nor this one. And this one, less worthy still...
352.context: CinematicNodeContext: Withers is muttering while reading an old scroll, seemingly bothered by someone’s qualificationsInternalNodeContext: Hirelings intro

419.speaker: Withers
419.context: CinematicNodeContext: Withers stows his scroll to speak with player

148.speaker: Player
148.text: 'Less worthy still'? More riddles from my resident jester.

58.speaker: Withers
58.text: I riddle thee not. I speak only what requires telling.
58.context: CinematicNodeContext: Withers stows his scroll to speak with player

92.speaker: Withers
92.text: Beyond mortal realms, there doth exist an amalgamation of spirits akin to thine own, ensnared by the treacherous cult of the Absolute, felled in its name.

339.speaker: Withers
339.text: They bear great discontentment with their destiny.

196.speaker: Withers
196.text: For a mere pittance of coin, I might summon the worthiest among them to lend aid to thy undertaking.

337.speaker: Player
337.text: Will these hirelings be joining me willingly?

18.speaker: Withers
18.text: Most willingly, forsooth. Their passions doth run deep for what hath been wrought upon them.

363.speaker: Player
363.text: Do you think I can trust these cultists?

141.speaker: Withers
141.text: Suspicion always haunts the guilty mind. My services are all that I can proffer thee. What thou wilt do with them is for thee to undertake.

159.speaker: Player
159.text: I would like to talk about hirelings.

447.speaker: Player
447.text: I would like to resurrect someone.

359.speaker: Withers
359.text: Patience. Thy colleague still peruses my ledger.

317.speaker: Withers
317.text: Thou canst not hire allies. I must speak with thy leader.

432.speaker: Withers
432.text: One of thy hirelings waits in thy camp.

125.speaker: Withers
125.text: Two of thy hirelings wait in thy camp.

113.speaker: Withers
113.text: All three of thy hirelings wait in thy camp.

110.speaker: Withers
110.text: No. Thy coinpurse is near empty.

74.speaker: Withers
74.text: There is no one to dismiss.

246.speaker: Withers
246.text: Only thy leader may banish hirelings.

130.speaker: Withers
130.text: Thou hast broken thy oath. Before I can aid thee, thou must atone.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: I'd like to talk about something else.

463.speaker: Withers
463.text: Hast thou seen the futility of thy actions?

31.speaker: Player
31.text: Sorry. I was a bit quick on the draw there.

131.speaker: Withers
131.text: An apology to one such as myself is but empty air.

127.speaker: Player
127.text: I know there's some way to find your weakness.

392.speaker: Withers
392.text: None thou wouldst likely ever possess.

279.speaker: Withers
279.text: Thou art not the first to say as much.

471.speaker: Withers
471.text: Thy wheel of Fate turns ever to the dark.
